title: Custodians of the Cosmos
description:
Join Prof Andy Lawrence from The Royal Observatory Edinburgh and eminent photographer Max Alexander for an exploration of the central role that space plays in our everyday lives.

Learn about the increasing threat of space debris and why studying the skies is of vital cultural and economic importance. Discover the people and technology that are working to protect this fragile environment and how unconstrained growth may put both space activity and astronomy at risk.

This discussion is centred on the themes of Max Alexander’s major photography exhibition, Our Fragile Space, viewable throughout the Festival at the foot of the Mound.

Presented by Royal Observatory Edinburgh and Royal Society of Edinburgh
description_teaser: Explore the importance of protecting the near space environment.

title: Flamencodanza

venue.name: C ARTS | C venues | C digital
venue.description: Our award-winning digital home for theatre, physical performance, circus, dance, opera, musicals, music, cabaret, spoken word, storytelling, children’s shows, talks, film, video, visual and performance art. Part of the vibrant, vivacious variety of C ARTS: a curated programme of international, independent work taking place at multiple city-centre locations, and online, in our 33rd year at the Fringe. It’s a festival all of its own. Make sure you see it all.
venue.disabled_description: The venue is an online venue showing digital work. Information about the programme is available on our website, www.CtheArts.com. The website has been designed to be as accessible as possible. Performances include some shows with a major visual component (e.g. dance, mime, circus, physical theatre) which may be suitable for those with restricted hearing, and some shows with a major aural component (eg spoken word, radio plays, music). Some shows may be close captioned. Full venue site is accessible, No wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. This is an online venue which can be visited virtually from the audience member's home or another accessible location

description: Award-winning flamenco dance from an international duo based in Spain. Flamenco, Brazilian music and jazz fuse in this inspirational showcase of strength, elegance and beauty embodied in Aylin Bayaz’s dance and Raul Mannola's guitar music. The shared passion and synergy of this five-year collaboration produces a unique experience of beauty and inspiration. ‘Flamencodanza is more than just a show – it’s a breathtaking journey, with its fusion of tradition and contemporary flair… leaving an enduring impression on every fortunate spectator’ (Dancelife.com.au). ‘Flamencodanza is hot, and you won’t see anything else like it’ (TheStageRaw.com). ‘Manola is amazing to watch’ (TheTVolution.com).
artist: Flamencodanza Aylin Bayaz with Raul Mannola (Spain)

title: Goose's Quizzes Elimination Game

venue.name: Assembly Rooms
venue.description: This classic building in the heart of the New Town is now the centre of a fantastic festival hub, hosting some of the finest theatre, comedy and music from around the world. The Assembly Rooms hosts three spaces indoors: the Music Hall, Ballroom and Drawing Room, with a Spiegeltent (The Bijou) and a studio space (Front Room) outside on George Street.
venue.disabled_description: Limited access to some parts of venue site, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, On street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. Accessible entrance is through the front doors.

warnings: Audience participation, Audience will be standing throughout, Audience required to walk or move around during the performance
description: With bigger prizes and brand-new rounds, Scotland's premiere quiz company triumphantly returns with the Elimination Game: Round Two! Through a series of make-or-break questions that pit you against your fellow audience members, test your knowledge – and your luck – to see if you will face elimination, or be crowned champion! A five-star reviewed hit in 2023, this unique blend of competition and camaraderie has something for everyone, from classic pub trivia to daft new game modes. There's only one winner per round, will you claim your moment of glory?

title: Thomas Elvin – This Might Sound Stupid, But…

venue.name: The Stand Comedy Club 5 & 6
venue.description: Across the road from the world Famous (Stand 1), Stand 5 and Stand 6 are located at The Place – a luxury four-star boutique townhouse hotel, situated in a stunning A-listed Georgian terrace in the heart of Edinburgh's New Town. Offering comfort and a roof terrace bar the venue also boosts a stylish restaurant and opulent cocktail bar. Venues accessible through courtyard at basement level. Latecomers may not be admitted.
venue.disabled_description: Limited access to some parts of venue site, No wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, On street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. Access via hotel's main entrance. Stand 6 is accessible for wheelchair users via service entrance at Dublin Street Lane South. 2 Wheelchair Spaces available per production (accessible WC). Stand 5 has two routes of entry both involve stairs. Both Stand 5 & 6 are fully seated. Seating is level and unfixed within the venue spaces. Staff are always available to assist customers, however we cannot help to carry customers

performance_space.name: Stand 5
performance_space.age_limit: Under 18s must be accompanied by an adult at all times. No under 18's after 9pm

description: Thomas Elvin brings his first show, This Might Sound Stupid, But…, to the Fringe. It’s bound to make you laugh. A show full of funny stories, jokes and of course stupidness from a comedian who’s idiocy hits new levels. Thomas has brought his comedy up and down the country for years, working his way up the comedy ladder. Come and see him fall off the ladder into the comedic abyss. 'Absolutely smashed it. Had the audience in tears' (The Stand Comedy Club).
artist: Thomas Elvin / The Stand Comedy Club

title: Off the Bench

venue.name: theSpace @ Niddry St
venue.description: Right in the middle of it all in the best location and part of our Royal Mile hub (10 theatres) we present two very special spaces, offering an array of new and established work – from theatre to musicals, dance, comedy and music, a real feast for all. The buzzing courtyard bar adjacent to the venue offers audiences pre and post-show drinks and an unrivalled Fringe experience.
venue.disabled_description: Full venue site is accessible, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. Small cobbled area leading to main entrance

description: A lighthearted yet empowering play which revolves around the lives of three female football players, playing for their local team, the Walcott Wrens. The play not only delves into the dynamics of their own personal struggles, but explores the broader theme of women’s representation in the world of sports. Our play is created and performed by an all-female team, as we believe in giving women the opportunity to tell their own stories.

title: You're SO F**king Croydon!

venue.name: Underbelly, Cowgate
venue.description: Running on the Fringe for over two decades, Underbelly Cowgate is home to some of the best talent and bars you can find at the Fringe. Complete with licensed bars, a café and six vivacious venues, open 'til the wee hours.
venue.disabled_description: Limited access to some parts of venue site, No wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. Access via a cobbled lane at Cowgate entrance - the lane is narrow this year due to construction works. There is ramped access to Belly Dancer and Bar. There are steps throughout the rest of the building - please contact our Box Office if we can potentially assist with wheelchair access requirements

warnings:
Audience participation, Contains distressing or potentially triggering themes, Strong language/swearing, More information
Contains references to drug use.
description: 'It was my nemesis, I hated Croydon with a real vengeance. It represented everything I didn't want in my life, everything I wanted to get away from. I think it's the most derogatory thing I can say about somebody or something: God, it's so f**king Croydon!' (David Bowie). You're SO F**king Croydon! explores noughties club culture and female resilience, interweaving music, dance, comedy, spoken word and Croydon celebrities. It's a f**k you in pink to the cant's and wont's and a strut down Croydon High Street in 2003. Featuring David Bowie.

title: Never Been So High

venue.name: French Institute in Scotland
venue.description: The Institut français d'Ecosse has been a historic Edinburgh Festival Fringe partner since opening in 1946. Our stunning venue in the heart of the Old Town is an unmissable attraction for Fringe audiences.
venue.disabled_description: Full venue site is accessible, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. The Institut français d’Ecosse and the main performance space (Salle Emilienne Moreau-Evrard) are fully accessible with step-free access available. Because of current health guidelines, we operate with a one-way system throughout the building with entrance via George IV Bridge only and exit through West Parliament Square

description: As Charlie Chaplin said, 'Pantomime is a universal language. Let Never Been So High open new horizons of your imagination. This solo performance explores connecting with your inner child amid life's challenges. It's not just entertainment; it's a profound experience that can change your perspective. The mime's skill ensures every moment is captivating, filled with magic, music, plot twists, and humor. The actress of the performance, Hope Lee, is the creator of the Kyiv Mime Theatre. When the war broke out, the Kyiv Mime Theatre decided to continue their art in the Netherlands.

title: Causey Lines Four

venue.name: Whitespace 76
venue.description: Whitespace 76 is a venue right in the heart of the festival between Bristo Sq and the Pleasance. Out-with the festival Whitespace is an art gallery and performance space for contemporary art.
venue.disabled_description: Full venue site is accessible, No wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas

description: For one week only, this unique and exciting exhibition is not to be missed. It is full of surprises, bringing colour with a dash of monochrome to the Whitespace Gallery, set in the historic Edinburgh South Side's East Crosscauseway. Our four uniquely individual Scottish artists have come together for the first time to produce a collaborative showing of new works providing the viewer with a challenging, eclectic mix of paintings, drawings, prints and textiles. The artists will be in the gallery during the exhibition and will be very happy to talk about the works on display.
artist: Irene Campbell, Carole Millar, John Nowak and Gillian Spanswick

title: Jane Flett & Grant Morrison: Demimonde
description: Jane Flett’s Freakslaw, ‘a queer punk masterpiece’, sees a dazzling funfair pull up in a rundown Scottish town, leaving mayhem and desire in its wake. Luda, the long-awaited first novel from comics legend Grant Morrison, imagines an alternate, hallucinatory Glasgow of drag queens, murder, and the occult. Here, we explore two new and truly surreal visions of Scotland from extraordinary storytellers. Chaired by Heather Parry.
description_teaser: Here, we explore two new and truly surreal visions of Scotland from extraordinary storytellers. Chaired by Heather Parry…

title: The Game of Life
description:
Join our researchers, create a DNA bracelet, and play the game of life! You’ll also have the chance to see for yourself how brains age using augmented reality glasses. Come along and discover the secrets to healthy brains.

Children must be accompanied by an adult.

Presented by the University of Edinburgh
description_teaser: How do your brain and thinking skills develop and change throughout your life? How important are your genes or is it all about how you choose to live your life?

title: Two Hearts: Til Death Do Us Hearts

venue.name: Pleasance Courtyard
venue.description: The Pleasance’s famous cobblestone Courtyard has been entertaining festival audiences since 1985 and is considered by many to be the very heart of the Fringe. Come join us for the best comedy, theatre and children's shows at 'the centre of the cultural universe' (Scotsman).
venue.disabled_description: A full accessibility guide can be found at www.pleasance.co.uk. Customers with access requirements are encouraged to contact the venue in advance and to make themselves known to a member of the team upon arrival. Full venue site is accessible, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. The Pleasance Courtyard is located uphill when accessing the venue from Cowgate. The outdoor spaces of the venue are a mix of cobblestones and tarmacked surfaces

warnings: Contains distressing or potentially triggering themes, Strobe lighting, Strong language/swearing
description: New Zealand's hottest comedy pop-music duo Two Hearts are back – now with more "vow" factor. A year ago, real-life power-couple Laura Daniel (Taskmaster NZ) and Joseph Moore (Snort) tied the knot, joined bank accounts and immediately drained it all for a lavish wedding. Join them for hot new songs about love, life and maintaining a successful relationship with your co-worker. ‘This generation's Flight of the Conchords' ***** (NZ Entertainment Podcast). ‘Don’t miss this’ ***** (DIVA Magazine). ‘A riot from start to finish’ **** (Fest). ***** (Beat Magazine). **** (BroadwayBaby.com). **** (TheWeeReview.com).

title: Andrew Mayer: Have Fun, Be Yourself

venue.name: theSpace @ Surgeons' Hall
venue.description: The modern festival's smartest multi-space destination venue. The ultimate powerhouse of live performance, offering a pulsating programme of diverse and inclusive work from every genre possible. Part of our 11-space hub at the very stylish Surgeons Quarter, well-stocked bars and great food has made this the perfect destination for audiences who tend to come and spend the day seeing a wide selection of award-winning shows from across the globe.
venue.disabled_description: Please contact us directly if you have any questions regarding disability access. Full venue site is accessible, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, On street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. There is a ramp to the venue entrance. Three of the theatres are on the ground floor and there is a passenger lift to the Grand Theatre

description: Comedian Andrew Mayer talks about his all-time best and worst dates (both with the same woman), and a third date with her many years later. At its core, this show is a love story, but leaves plenty of room for other nonsense, including coming-of-age, the ongoing struggle against anxiety, and growing up with supportive parents.

title: Love Your Work

venue.name: Greenside @ George Street
venue.description: With six spaces, Greenside @ George Street will become one of the largest multi-space hubs at the Fringe. We’re confident that one of our spaces will be just right for you. Add to that a beautiful indoor bar, lobby seating and that infamous Greenside charm. we couldn’t be more excited to share with our new Fringe home.
venue.address: The Royal Society of Edinburgh, 22-26 George Street
venue.disabled_description: Full venue site is accessible, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. Step free access to the venue

warnings: Audience participation, Contains distressing or potentially triggering themes, Strong language/swearing
description: Love Your Work is a bi-annual work-in-progress showcase dedicated to facilitating dance and mental health. In this Fringe edition we present work by EQ Dance and friends of the company. 2024 Programme: Me and My Dyslexia: a neurodiversity solo comedy dance theatre work by David West. Individual and Intimacies: an interactive dance "TED Talk" with Alex Tsiapi and David West. EQ Dance Co works in collaboration to create and deliver dance experiences with impact based in the UK around themes of mental health and the human experience. Artistic Director: David West. Produced by Dance Horizons.

title: Standing on the Shoulders of Idiots

venue.name: The Stand Comedy Club 5 & 6
venue.description: Across the road from the world Famous (Stand 1), Stand 5 and Stand 6 are located at The Place – a luxury four-star boutique townhouse hotel, situated in a stunning A-listed Georgian terrace in the heart of Edinburgh's New Town. Offering comfort and a roof terrace bar the venue also boosts a stylish restaurant and opulent cocktail bar. Venues accessible through courtyard at basement level. Latecomers may not be admitted.
venue.disabled_description: Limited access to some parts of venue site, No wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, On street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. Access via hotel's main entrance. Stand 6 is accessible for wheelchair users via service entrance at Dublin Street Lane South. 2 Wheelchair Spaces available per production (accessible WC). Stand 5 has two routes of entry both involve stairs. Both Stand 5 & 6 are fully seated. Seating is level and unfixed within the venue spaces. Staff are always available to assist customers, however we cannot help to carry customers

performance_space.name: Stand 5
performance_space.age_limit: Under 18s must be accompanied by an adult at all times. No under 18's after 9pm

description: Sir Isaac Newton is famous for claiming that his scientific discoveries were made possible ‘by standing on the shoulders of giants’. But he’s also famous for jabbing himself in the eye with a needle. Quantum physicist Dr Nick Werren (Heriot-Watt University) discovers how an argument on medieval Twitter shaped the physics of light and accidentally resulted in hundreds of miles of French countryside disappearing into thin air.
artist: Fair Pley / The Stand Comedy Club

title: Planetarium Late: Pink Floyd’s The Dark Side of the Moon
description:
Experience a mesmeric and immersive 360° show with breath-taking views of the Solar System, set to the official 1973 album in spectacular surround sound. Half a century after its launch in a planetarium, this truly is a unique way to experience this album.

Presented by Dynamic Earth
description_teaser: After a sell-out run during the Edinburgh Fringe, Pink Floyd's The Dark Side of the Moon planetarium experience is back!

title: Are You Sitting Comfortably?
description: Start your day with a magical half hour of stories for children and families. Appearing today: poet and storyteller, Rachel Plummer.
description_teaser: Start your day with a magical half hour of stories for children and families. Appearing today: poet and storyteller, Rachel Plummer…

title: Stories and Scran
description: Enjoy tasty food and brilliant performances from local people. Returning for its fifth year, Stories and Scran celebrates dynamic, thought-provoking work created by our Citizen participants. Expect diverse and creative talent from Project Esperanza’s Women’s Group, WHALE Arts, the Book Festival’s own Adults Writing Group, and Citizen Collective. And Scran Academy are back to serve up delicious, sweet treats you can enjoy during the event.
description_teaser: Enjoy tasty food and brilliant performances from local people. Returning for its fifth year, Stories and Scran celebrates dynamic, thought-provoking work created by our Citizen participants. Expect diverse and creative talent from Project Esperanza’s…

title: Inside Out: Water (Activity)
description:
Join authors Fiona Stafford and Max Leonard for a hike around some of Edinburgh's most ancient sites, led by geologist Angus Miller. Amidst the spectacular scenery of Holyrood Park, we'll look at the ways in which the city's landscapes have been moulded by ice and water, and learn more about the forces that shape the ground beneath our feet.

25 places available. This activity should be suitable for anyone who hikes or walks regularly. There will be a qualified leader present, but participants must take responsibility for their own safety, dress appropriately, and carry whatever equipment they might expect to need.

Angus Miller is a geologist and educator, who has been guiding people around the landscapes of Scotland for over 20 years.

Look for the twinned ‘Inside Out: Water’ event on Saturday 24 August where you can hear Max Leonard and Fiona Stafford in conversation about water's impact on our past and future, as explored in their latest books.
description_teaser: Join authors Fiona Stafford and Max Leonard for a hike around some of Edinburgh's most ancient sites, led by geologist Angus Miller. Amidst the spectacular scenery of Holyrood Park, we'll look at the ways in which the city's landscapes have been moulded…

title: Have Lunch with Rachel Roddy
description:
Experience the delights of authentic Roman cooking with Rachel Roddy, food columnist for the Guardian and award-winning author of Five Quarters: Recipes and Notes from a Kitchen in Rome. Using the best seasonal ingredients, Roddy will create a mouth-watering Italian feast before your eyes, inspiring you with secrets of cooking as the Romans do and sharing what she’s learned about resourcefulness, simplicity, and joy from two decades of being immersed in Italian culinary culture. Roddy will be in conversation with Sophie Moxon.

Ticket includes: a welcome snack and drink, two-course lunch, drinks on the table, plus an exclusive recipe booklet.

Elliott's Studio is at 21 Sciennes Road, Edinburgh, EH9 1NX
description_teaser: Using the best seasonal ingredients, Roddy will create a mouth-watering Italian feast before your eyes, inspiring you with secrets of cooking as the Romans do and sharing what she’s learned about resourcefulness, simplicity, and joy from two decades of…

title: JONATHAN: By Order of the Peaky Grindrs

venue.name: Just the Tonic at The Caves
venue.description: During the Festival Fringe in Edinburgh, the Caves transform into a captivating labyrinth of creativity and performance unlike any other. Tucked away beneath the city's bustling streets, these ancient underground chambers provide a uniquely atmospheric setting for an eclectic array of shows and events. Stepping into the Caves during the Fringe is like entering another world altogether. The dimly lit passageways and rugged stone walls create an otherworldly ambiance.
venue.disabled_description: Limited access to some parts of venue site, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. There is a cobbled street leading to the entrance of The Big Room

description: Remorsed, de-bedded, cried. Divorced, debted, survived. Join Jonathan as he hosts an hour of relatable hilarity. Hailing all the way from London, this is his Edinburgh Fringe debut. Friends, fans and stalkers – everyone is welcome! 'I always thought you were very funny' (ex-husband). For his last performance, Sunday 25th, Jonathan will be turning 40 on stage. Tickets for this special show are £40 with profits donated to Fringe Society.

title: Micky Overman: Hold On

venue.name: Monkey Barrel Comedy (The Tron)
venue.description: Monkey Barrel Comedy is in the heart of Edinburgh's Old Town, with the best acts in the best rooms at the Fringe. Home to both Edinburgh Comedy Awards in 2022, and the Best Comedy Show at last year's Fringe. 19 award nominees since 2017. Scotland’s Best Venue 2023 (Chortle Awards). “Down there at the Monkey Barrel, there’s something in the water, and I can't stop drinking it!” Sam Campbell.
venue.disabled_description: Limited access to some parts of venue site, No wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas

description: All of a sudden, comedian Micky Overman finds her life going the direction she’s always wanted. The path has been set, she just has to follow it. So why is she finding that so hard?  A show about change, commitment and letting go of your old self. Join Micky as she desperately fights against her old coping mechanisms, whilst contemplating love, the art of gift giving and Ozzy Osbourne. ***** (Funny Women). **** (Scotsman). **** (Chortle.co.uk). **** (BroadwayBaby.com). **** (List). 'Top-notch lines that wouldn’t be out of place in an A-lister’s Netflix special' (Chortle.co.uk).

title: Beowulf and Grendel

venue.name: PBH's Free Fringe @ CC Blooms
venue.description: Buzzing, unpretentious gay club over two levels with bars and dance-floor. Every day during the Fringe we host several five-star PBH Free Fringe shows, bespoke cocktails and international beers. Kitchen open every day until 22:00. Children welcome before 21:00.
venue.disabled_description: Limited access to some parts of venue site, No wheelchair accessible toilet

performance_space.name: CC Blooms
performance_space.age_limit: Children are permitted, with adult, 11:00-21:00. After 21:00, 18+ only.

description: The gripping tale of a prince’s struggle against evil, adapted and performed by award-nominated actor Evan Quinlan, brought to you by the people behind the fringe hit Brain Hemingway. Praise for Brain Hemingway: 'Brilliant' ****(TheQR.co.uk). ***** (TheNewCurrent.co.uk). Prince Beowulf has answered a neighboring kingdom’s call for aid when they are set upon by a vicious monster called Grendel. Quinlan’s adaptation from the translation by Francis Barton Gummere brings to life the quintessential adventure epic, concluding in the iconic clash of epic poetry’s most legendary characters.

title: Rita Bullwinkel & Elisa Shua Dusapin: In the Ring
description:
Two new novels drop us into extraordinary worlds. In Rita Bullwinkel’s 2024 Booker-longlisted Headshot, the eight best teenage girl boxers in the United States step into the ring to fight for their futures. A costume designer arrives in Russia to dress acrobats in Elisa Shua Dusapin’s Vladivostok Circus. Join Bullwinkel and Dusapin as they talk with Tice Cin about the beauty, competitive spirit, and brutality of their novels’ settings.

Supported by Institut français du Royaume-Uni.
description_teaser: Two new novels drop us into extraordinary worlds. In Rita Bullwinkel’s 2024 Booker-longlisted Headshot, the eight best teenage girl boxers in the United States step into the ring to fight for their futures. A costume designer arrives in Russia to dress…

title: Scaffolding

venue.name: Pleasance Dome
venue.description: The Pleasance Dome is at the very centre of the now famous Bristo Square, featuring the very best comedy and theatre. With great bars and cafes, including our sunny outdoor plaza, come soak up the legendary Pleasance atmosphere throughout the day and stay for the fun late into the night.
venue.disabled_description: All performance spaces are accessible. A full accessibility guide can be found at www.pleasance.co.uk. Full venue site is accessible, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. A full accessibility guide can be found at www.pleasance.co.uk. Customers with access requirements are encouraged to contact the venue in advance and to make themselves known to a member of the team upon arrival to access lifts

performance_space.name: Jack Dome
performance_space.age_limit: Under 16s accompanied by an adult may be on the premises until 00:00. 16-17 year olds until 01:00 in Potterrow Plaza and 03:00 in Pleasance Dome. Under 18s may not approach a bar. Licensing restrictions may be subject to change.

warnings:
Contains distressing or potentially triggering themes, Strong language/swearing, More information
Reference to grief and low parental capacity.
description: Sheridan is having a bad day. Her church is closing, Adult Social Care are on her case and she can't work out what ingredients she needs to make a bomb. With no one else to turn to, she climbs the scaffolding around the leaking church steeple with a few questions for Whoever Is In Charge.
artist: Documental Productions, Bristol Old Vic and Pleasance

title: Mass Karaoke – Bangers Only!

venue.name: Ballie Ballerson
venue.description: We are a free entry venue every single night! We have a full bar and homemade pizzas served throughout the shows, as well as our giant glowing ball pit, and massive slide to get you back down to the bar. We have all the free fun under one roof!
venue.disabled_description: Limited access to some parts of venue site, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas

description: Free entry to mass karaoke every night! We only play absolute bangers from every decade. Come and join us for some free crowd karaoke in our huge split level amphitheatre venue. Enjoy a free night of entertainment at one of Edinburgh's silliest venues.
